intro: Scabiosa stellata subsp. simplex, commonly known as the starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and rocky areas. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to ecological gardens.
